title: Cheesy Chicken & Spinach Besan Chilla
instructions: In a bowl, combine besan, spinach, chicken, cheese, green chilies, onion, ginger, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder (if using), and salt.
Gradually add water and whisk until you get a smooth batter, slightly thicker than pancake batter.
Heat a non-stick pan or tawa and drizzle with oil/ghee.
Pour a ladleful of batter onto the hot pan and spread it into a thin circle.
Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
Serve hot with your favorite chutney or yogurt.
description: Savory and cheesy besan chilla packed with protein and greens, a perfect gluten-free Indian breakfast.

title: Fish & Coconut Flour Appam
instructions: In a bowl, combine coconut flour, flaked fish, yogurt, onion, green chilies, curry leaves, cumin seeds, mustard seeds, and salt.
Gradually add water and mix until you get a smooth batter, slightly thicker than pancake batter.
Heat an appam pan and drizzle with coconut oil.
Pour a ladleful of batter into each mold and swirl the pan to spread the batter thinly.
Cover and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the edges are crispy and the center is cooked through.
description: Light and fluffy appams made with coconut flour and fish, a healthy and delicious South Indian breakfast option.

title: Scrambled Eggs with Paneer & Spices
ingredients: Paneer (Indian cottage cheese) crumbled ½ cup
instructions: Heat oil/ghee in a pan and sauté onion, tomato, green chili, and ginger until softened.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder (if using), garam masala, and salt. Cook for a minute.
Add crumbled paneer and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Whisk eggs in a separate bowl and pour them into the pan.
Scramble the eggs with the paneer mixture until cooked through.
Garnish with cilantro and serve hot with gluten-free toast or roti.
description: A protein-packed and flavorful Indian-style scrambled eggs with paneer and spices, a perfect start to your day.
